statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Avin is studying isosceles trapezoids. An isosceles trapezoid is a convex quadrilateral with two opposite parallel bases, two equal-length legs and positive area. In this problem, we further require that the two legs are not parallel. Given n segments, you are asked to find the number of isosceles trapezoids whose 4 edges are from these segments and the greatest common divisor of their lengths is 1. Two congruent isosceles trapezoids are counted only once.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: The first line contains a number n (4 ≤ n ≤ 2, 000). The second line contains n numbers, each of which represents the length of a segment (the length is within [2, 10000]).

statement.title: Output
statement.content: Print the number of non-congruent isosceles trapezoids.
